channel.title: AP European History Question
channel.description:
Hey mates,
I have a question that I don't know. It is from Ch.17: An Age of Enlightenment. I have to write over 7 sentences discussing the answer to the question. I looked in the book, and can't find the answer so I need help please.
Question: In what type of social environment did the philosophers thrive, and what role did women play in that environment.
Thanks, Leader

item.title: AP European History Question
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Wtf…AP Euro is senior year for us… we have World Hist, USH I, AP USH, then Asian, Euro, w/e.

And why do you do homework at home?

item.title: AP European History Question
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

Well, that site didn’t really help me out. The book wasn’t even on there. Thanks anyway for trying. I do appreciate your help, and hope that we will become friends.

Thanks again,
Leader

Read full topic

item.title: AP European History Question
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

well good luck with the class. Sounds hard.
when I dont understand something (which is most of the time because im either sleeping or the teacher sucks at explaining it), I just ask a friend either that period, or afterwards at lunch or something. Ill just ask like “dude do you understand what the hell ms. St. Hilaire was talking about when she was explaining the national convention? who exactly was in it?”
youll understand things better when they are discussed and put into your own words, instead of the literal definitions out of the book with all of those boring words

Read full topic

item.title: AP European History Question
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:6, topic:27117”]tell me if you can find your book on this page
http://www.thomsonedu.com/thomsonedu/courses.do?disciplinenumber=21

im having trouble
if you can find it there, theres a possibility there are chapter reviews and short quizzes for it. hope this helps took me a little while to find it, because had to find out the publisher

aw crap…the official website for it is pretty shitty. sorry
I dont remember exactly, but i saw a comercial the other day for some study website that sounded good except it was 30 bucks and looked like its for elementary kids
maybe you should either pay more attention in class, or try to ask friends for the answers so you can understand what you read more.[/quote]

Well, I still get straight A’s. The problem is I spend way too much time doing the AP European History homework and studying for the tests.

Read full topic

item.title: AP European History Question

item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

tell me if you can find your book on this page
http://www.thomsonedu.com/thomsonedu/courses.do?disciplinenumber=21

im having trouble
if you can find it there, theres a possibility there are chapter reviews and short quizzes for it. hope this helps took me a little while to find it, because had to find out the publisher

aw crap…the official website for it is pretty shitty. sorry
I dont remember exactly, but i saw a comercial the other day for some study website that sounded good except it was 30 bucks and looked like its for elementary kids
maybe you should either pay more attention in class, or try to ask friends for the answers so you can understand what you read more.

item.title: AP European History Question
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

exps35:

im a sophmore

Same, did you find any answer?[br][size=1]Posted at: November 19, 2006, 09:14:59 PM[/size][hr]Do you know any good history study guide sites that have the answers on them? Have any tips for studying on studying for a test? Tips on doing homework faster?

I spend like 3 hours each day just doing AP European History homework. That is way too long.

Any help is appreciated.

Thanks,
Leader

Read full topic

item.title: AP European History Question
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

Western Civilization Comprehensive Volume Fifth Edition
By Jackson. J. Spielvogel

What grade are you in? How long does it take for you to do history homework?

Dude it takes me like 2-3 hours each night just on History homework. On the weekend it takes me like 8 hours.

Read full topic

item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

mind stating what book it is? if its one of the big ones, they have answers to all the questions online

the answer might be in their study, and when the women do the dishes.

but i dont know
I just finished enlightenment in World History Honors, but never heard the answer to that question. sorry
